jobDescription: Associate Scientist, Biochemistry  Position SummaryThis position will be responsible for the characterization of enzymes expressed in mammalian and prokaryotic cell systems. This resource will apply a wide knowledge of protein quantitation and analysis techniques both in vitro and in cell-based models, especially related to enzymology, to characterize protein products. This position will share responsibility for propagation of prokaryotic and mammalian cell lines and purification of enzyme products using established protocols.Roles and Responsibilities Characterization of protein activity, quantity, and purity in in vitro and cell-based assaysDevelopment and implementation of enzymatic assaysProtein purification from prokaryotic and mammalian cell lines using established protocolsEvaluation of target mRNA expression levelsPropagation of mammalian and prokaryotic cell lines expressing biologicsDocumentation of all work in an electronic notebookAnalysis and presentation of results to larger scientific group Requirements BS or equivalent in scientific discipline, and min of 2 years related lab experience, or MS or equivalent with 0-2 years of experienceProven track record for protein characterization techniques, especially related to enzyme activityExperience with protein purification from prokaryotic and mammalian expression systemsFamiliarity with mRNA quantification (e.g., qRT-PCR)Able to function both independently and as part of a teamDemonstration of detailed record keeping and data documentation Experience and Skills Enzyme activity assays and cell-based activity assays.Protein quantitation by multiple methods, SDS-PAGE, gel staining, and western blotting.Quantification of mRNA (e.g., qRT-PCR).Mammalian and prokaryotic cell propagation, harvesting, and lysis.Familiarity with protein purification using established protocols preferred.Ability to support multiple projects simultaneously. Travel Occasional travel to scientific conferences to present work or for training courses
